page.title: 01The Shore At W Gailes Golf C
page.content: The area is more than two thirds sea popular for local fishing boats to moor when fishing for mackeral. There is a large rock named the Lappock Rock beneath the water. The rock is marked by a bouy seen from the shore.The rest of the block is made up of beach and a stretch of golf course.The beach is used by joggers and dog walkers from Barassie. To stop erosion the beach is at this part being held in place by concrete blocks and wire. Between the beach and golf-course is a stretch of high sand dunes. Included in the block are two fairways of the western Gailes private golf Club. This course is a typicla seaside links course used during the preliminary round of the open championship.
